title: Cylinder Head, Remove and Install (Z 22 SE)

substeps.text: Reposition the fuel lines (3) to one side.
Release and detach the wiring harness connector.

steps.text: Detach the ground cable from the cylinder head.
Undo the bolts on the rear wheels.
Remove the wheel arch trim on the left and right–hand side.
Disconnect the lambda probe wiring harness connector (2).
Remove the lower engine splash shield (1).
Remove the cover from the exhaust system.

substeps.text: Open the coolant drain plug (1) at the radiator and the coolant
Rotate the crankshaft in the normal direction of rotation to

steps.text: Unbolt the camshaft timing chain guide rail.
Disconnect the wiring harness connector (1) for the tank breather valve (2).
Undo the bolts on the oil dipstick guide tube (2).
Remove the oil dipstick guide tube.

substeps.text: Pull the oil dipstick guide tube out from the oil pan and lift

steps.text: Detach the tank breather valve line (1).

substeps.text: Reposition the line to one side.
Until the head of the bolt comes free.
Reposition the ground cable to one side.

steps.text: Take out the engine control unit.
Detach the wiring harness connector (1) from the injectors (2).

substeps.text: Release and detach the 4 wiring harness connectors.

steps.text: Detach the MAP sensor wiring harness connector.
Detach the throttle body wiring harness connector.

substeps.text: Release and detach the wiring harness connector.

steps.text: Disconnect the tank breather line from the intake manifold.
Unbolt the exhaust gas recirculation pipe.
Detach the wiring harness connector from the exhaust gas recirculation valve.

substeps.text: Release and detach the wiring harness connector.
Reposition the wiring harness to one side.

steps.text: Undo the bolts on the intake manifold (1).

Note: If there is no marking (1) on the camshaft timing chain tensioner (2), then it should be replaced with a new camshaft timing chain tensioner (part number 24 448 509) including a new camshaft timing chain tensioner rail (part number 24 449 448).
Remove the camshaft timing chain tensioner (1).

substeps.text: Hold the exhaust camshaft by the hexagon.
Hold the intake camshaft by the hexagon.

steps.text: Note: Undo the bolts in the order shown.
Remove the cylinder head (1). Note: 2 technicians required

substeps.text: Place the cylinder head on wooden blocks.
Take off the cylinder head gasket (2).

steps.text: Install new intake manifold gaskets (1) and (2).
Clean the sealing surfaces and bores.

substeps.text: Cylinder block, cylinder head, front exhaust pipe.

steps.text: Place the cylinder head (1) in place. Note: 2 technicians required

substeps.text: Fit a new cylinder head gasket (2).

steps.text: Attach KM-6148 to the cylinder head.

substeps.text: Use the positioning bolt from KM-6148
Feed the camshaft timing chain by hand through the timing
Chain link (copper colour) (1) to INT marking (2) on the intake
Rotate the exhaust camshaft by the hexagon until the exhaust
Hold the camshaft by the hexagon.

steps.text: Attach the camshaft timing chain guide rail.
Install the camshaft timing chain tensioner.

substeps.text: Insert the piston into the housing.
Clamp the piston at the square into a vice.

Turn clockwise to lock the internal piston (6) in the last
latch position (5).

steps.text: Release the camshaft timing chain tensioner by pressing on the tensioner rail or the camshaft timing chain (using a blunt tool – e.g. a rounded assembly lever). Note: If the TDC markings no longer line up with the coloured chain links, refit the camshaft timing chain. Once the crankshaft has been rotated another turn they will no longer line up.

substeps.text: Rotate the crankshaft in the normal direction of rotation to

steps.text: Attach KM-6148 . Note: In this position the cams (1) and (2) of cylinder no. 4 point upwards.

substeps.text: Slide the positioning bolts (5) into the designated bores (3)

steps.text: Route the tank breather valve wiring harness.
Attach the exhaust gas recirculation pipe.
Attach the wiring harness connector for the throttle body.
Attach the MAP sensor wiring harness connector.
Attach the injector wiring harness connector.

substeps.text: Clean the engine control unit and the plug contacts with
Attach and secure the wiring harness connector.

steps.text: Connect the tank breather valve line.
Insert the oil dipstick guide tube.

substeps.text: Coat the oil seals with silicone grease (white).
Insert the oil dipstick guide tube as far as the stop into the
Attach the knock sensor wiring harness connector.

steps.text: Attach the oil dipstick guide tube.
Connect the tank breather valve wiring harness connector.
Attach the cover for the exhaust system.
Attach the lower engine splash shield.
Connect the lambda probe wiring harness connector.
Attach the wheel arch trim on the left and right–hand side.

substeps.text: Attach and secure the wiring harness connector.
Insert the fuel lines into the clip.

steps.text: Fill up with engine oil and check the oil level.
Fill up with coolant and correct as necessary – see operation "Cooling System, Fill Up and Bleed.

torqueValues.component: Attach the camshaft timing chain guide rail.
Attach the camshaft timing chain guide rail.
Install the camshaft timing chain tensioner.
Attach the exhaust gas recirculation pipe.
Attach the exhaust gas recirculation pipe.
Attach the oil dipstick guide tube.

warnings:
Fuel may escape
– observe the safety regulations and relevant national
legislation.

5.  
Release the fuel pressure.
 



Fuel may escape
– observe the safety regulations and relevant national
legislation.
 



•  
Release the fuel pressure with the pressure tester KM-J-34730-91 (1) via test connection (2).
 



–
Collect any escaping fuel in a suitable container.

The cylinder head must
only be removed when the engine is cold (i.e. at room
temperature).
4 Torx bolts and 10 hexagon bolts

Check that the TDC
reference points line up.
Chain link (1) to EXH marking (2) on the exhaust camshaft
sprocket

65.  
Install the exhaust camshaft sprocket.
 



Check that the TDC
reference points line up.
Chain link (1) to EXH marking (2) on the exhaust camshaft
sprocket
 



•  
Pull back the positioning bolt from KM-6148 .
 





•  
Rotate the exhaust camshaft by the hexagon until the exhaust
camshaft sprocket is seated in the guide.
 





•  
Use a new bolt.

Failure to follow this
instruction could cause the camshaft timing chain to jump.
notes:
Rotate the crankshaft in the normal direction of rotation to
TDC on cylinder no. 4 (marking 1).
 In this position
the cams of cylinder no. 4 point upwards.

Undo the bolts in
the order shown.
 



•  
Undo the bolts (90°).
 





•  
Undo the bolts (180°).

Remove the cylinder head (1).
 2 technicians
required
 



•  
Place the cylinder head on wooden blocks.
 





•  
Take off the cylinder head gasket (2).

Place the cylinder head (1) in place.
 2 technicians
required
 



•  
Fit a new cylinder head gasket (2).
 Note:   The OBEN / TOP
mark must face upwards.
 





•  
Note:
When placing the cylinder head on the upper part of the cylinder
block, guide the camshaft timing chain up through the timing case,
e.g. with a bent piece of electrode wire (to be fabricated by the
technician).

Fit a new cylinder head gasket (2).
 The OBEN / TOP
mark must face upwards.

Use new cylinder head bolts (hexagon bolts).
 Observe the
tightening sequence.
 



–
Tightening torque (M10) 30 Nm + 75°
+ 75° + 15°

Feed the camshaft timing chain by hand through the timing
case.
 The TDC reference
points on the timing chain are indicated by coloured links in the
chain. These must line up with the markings on the timing
sprockets.

Release the camshaft timing chain tensioner by pressing on the
tensioner rail or the camshaft timing chain (using a blunt tool
– e.g. a rounded assembly lever).
 If the TDC
markings no longer line up with the coloured chain links, refit the
camshaft timing chain. Once the crankshaft has been rotated another
turn they will no longer line up.

Attach KM-6148 .
 In this position
the cams (1) and (2) of cylinder no. 4 point upwards.
 



•  
Attach KM-6148 with the enclosed
bolts (4).
 





•  
Slide the positioning bolts (5) into the designated bores (3)
on the camshaft sprockets.

Attach and secure the wiring harness connector.
 Check for proper
seating and good electrical contact.

Use new gaskets.
 The sealing lips
of the seals (1) must be inserted into the groove on the cylinder
head cover.
 



–
Tightening torque 9 Nm
